newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to issue T-bills on September 24.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to issue T-bills on September 24.

text.p: Ukraine's central bank will auction three-month, six-month, nine-month and 12-month discount treasury bills on September 24, a central bank official said on Monday.
The central bank is not setting the issue volume in advance, the bank's capital markets and exchange department said.

At the last auction of three-month discount T-bills on September 19, the bank sold 15.701 million hryvnias worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 57.25 percent. The average price was 87.51 hryvnias.

At the last auction of six-month discount T-bills on September 19, the bank sold 1.016 million hryvnias worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 59.50 percent. The average price was 77.12 hryvnias.

At the last auction of nine-month discount T-bills on August 21, the bank sold 3.551 billion karbovanets worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 56.21 percent. The average price was 7.040 million karbovanets.
At the last auction of 12-month discount T-bills on September 17, the bank sold 6,000 hryvnias worth of paper, with an average annualised yield of 31.67 percent. The average price was 76.00 hryvnias.
On September 2, Ukraine introduced the hryvnia and removed the interim karbovanets currency from circulation on September 16. One hryvnia equals 100,000 karbovanets.
